questions.title: The Idea Maze
questions.prompt: Walk us through the 'idea maze'. You've arrived at your current solution, but what other paths did you consider and reject?
followups: Why is your current approach the right one?
What did you learn from the paths you didn't take?
How do you know you're not in a local maximum?

questions.title: Competitors (Direct)
questions.prompt: Who are your top 3 direct competitors?
followups: What do they do better than you?
What do you do better than them?
If a customer chooses them over you, what is the reason?

questions.title: The 'Evil' Competitor Question
questions.prompt: What would you do if Google/Amazon/Meta launched a competing feature tomorrow for free?
followups: Is there a world where you still win?
What do you have that they can't copy?
Is your market big enough for them to care?

questions.title: Go-to-Market: First 1000 Users
questions.prompt: How exactly will you get your first 1,000 users?
followups: What is your #1 acquisition channel right now?
Is that channel scalable?
How much does it cost to acquire a user (CAC)?

questions.title: Retention & Cohort Analysis
questions.prompt: Show us your retention curve. Do users stick around?
followups: What is your D1, D7, D30 retention?
What does your cohort chart look like?
What is the #1 reason users churn?

questions.title: Growth Rate
questions.prompt: What is your week-over-week growth rate?
followups: Is that accelerating or decelerating?
What are the three things you are doing to move this number?
What is your goal for the next 4 weeks?

questions.title: Unit Economics (Basic)
questions.prompt: What is your Customer Acquisition Cost (CAC) and Lifetime Value (LTV)?
followups: What is your payback period?
How did you calculate LTV? What is your assumption for customer lifespan?
Is your unit economy improving or getting worse as you scale?

questions.title: Market Size (TAM)
questions.prompt: What is your Total Addressable Market (TAM)? How did you calculate it?
followups: Is this a billion dollar market?
Are you doing a top-down or bottom-up calculation?
How many people actually have this problem AND will pay for it?

questions.title: Differentiation
questions.prompt: How are you different from [leading competitor]? Be specific.
followups: Is that difference defensible?
How long will it take them to copy that feature?
Do customers actually care about that difference?

questions.title: The 'Unfair' Advantage
questions.prompt: What is your unfair advantage? Why are you the right team?
followups: What unique insight do you have?
Do you have domain expertise?
Do you have proprietary data or distribution?

questions.title: Co-founder Dynamics
questions.prompt: Tell me about the biggest disagreement you and your co-founder have had. How was it resolved?
followups: Who makes the final decision when you disagree?
How do you handle stress as a team?
What would your co-founder say is your biggest weakness?

questions.title: Scaling the Niche
questions.prompt: You are dominating a small niche today. How do you turn that into a huge company?
followups: What is the adjacent market you attack next?
What needs to be true for that expansion to work?
What stops you from doing that today?
